pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.1.6_0: Legal procedures done according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction—this is called “legitimately”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.1.7_0: If he gives his consent, and then criticizes the procedure, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.1_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he criticizes it after giving his consent, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.2_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he criticizes it after giving his consent, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.3_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he criticizes it after giving his consent, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.4_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as legitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.5_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they is unsure of it, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.6_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as such, there is no offense.
